meanings.definition: Treat (a sacred place or thing) with violent disrespect.
meanings.sent1: The vandal desecrates the church by spray painting its walls.
meanings.sent2: It is wrong to desecrate a cemetery by littering on the graves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child thought it would be funny to desecrate the library books by drawing in them.
meanings.sent4: His actions desecrate the memory of those who fought for our freedom.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist desecrates the blank canvas with his rebellious art.

meanings.definition: Violate the sacred character of a place or language.
meanings.sent1: The developers desecrate the natural beauty of the land by building a shopping mall.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to desecrate the traditions of our ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes sometimes unintentionally desecrate the seriousness of the topic.
meanings.sent4: Her careless words desecrate the sanctity of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The invasive species desecrates the delicate ecosystem of the forest.
